content: Very accurate reproduction of the arcade Gauntlet video game. If I was going to improve it I would allow networked multi-player and Bluetooth controller capability. EDIT- It now supports Bluetooth controllers, rock on!
Feel like I am 8 again... Missed this game so much! Must remember I am 42, but nothing wrong feeling like I am 8! Thank you devs! üòÅüòÅüòÅ
replyContent: Thank you very much for your kind words, only a single developer here, I'm in the process of updating the animation system, to make it smoother.

content: Needs more development the enemies literally do not hurt you at all ever There is a crowd of ghosts and there isnt even a health bar
replyContent: In what why, the health is on the left hand side and its a number that decreases every second, most enemies melee you a ghost walks into you but goes straight away, same as the original.

content: Game is underdeveloped. Controls are basic. Potions dont work and for $1.50 you get what you pay for!
replyContent: How can It be underdeveloped, how else can you do touch, for a fast paist game like this. You need to press the potion buttons to use them, if there is anything else get in touch.

content: Almost exact replica of the 1985 arcade classic. Quick question, what gamepad key is it to use potion?
replyContent: if your using touchpad "screen", click the potions buttons, if not it's the trigger buttons, you can check out the information on the main menu, look for an icon that looks like a gamepad.

content: You can't shoot the food and from the bit played I never died
replyContent: Thank you for your reply, you're correct in the rewrite I did for this version, I inadvertently deleted the code that should make the food disappear if hit by a projectile, I've reset the health to decrease by a single point every second, whereas before it was 0.5 or half a second, it's a fine line, I update this in the upcoming release.

content: Legendary game. Must try at least.
replyContent: Thank you very much for your kind words.

content: So happy to finally see this in the play store! Thank you for replying to my review. I don't use any xbox or ps controllers. Just the on screen touch screen controls, so I have no idea how those affect performance.
replyContent: I'll see what I can do, I've successfully tested the PS4 controller, But I'm waiting for the XBOX controller I had to order as I don't have a PS4/XBOX console, should arrive on the 20th October, says Microsoft.

content: Its a classic
replyContent: I'm glad you're enjoying it, in the up and coming version, I've added gamepad support, 8bitdo, Xbox, PS4 controllers, should work, as well as the redesign of the UI, and the codebase.

content: Very cool. Just like the original game. You can't beat the price for $1.49. Thanks for making a very cool retro game. Long live Gauntlet. It is going to work with gamepad controllers in the near future. Awesome. Thanks.
replyContent: Hi Daniel, sorry for taking so long to reply, Good News I'm in the process of adding GamePad Controllers at the moment I'm trying to cover PS4, XBox and I'm using 8BitDo SN30 Pro+ controller, so watch this space.

content: i love this game it absolutely brilliant so many hours playing at the coast in summer when i was a kid happy days redone
replyContent: I'm glad you're enjoying it, I've been asked many times over the nearly three years since it was released, about GamePad compatibility I'm in process of doing that very thing I'm trying to cover PS4, XBox and I'm using 8BitDo SN30 Pro+ controller, for development and testing, there is also more to come, but I don't want to spoil it for you.

content: Wont let me refund. I love the game but i just dont have time to actually enjoy it. I GAVE IT A ONE STAR CAUSE YOU DONT REFUND
replyContent: I'm sorry to here you don't have time to enjoy the game but its unfair you give it a single star, because of that. Refunding is a Google thing nothing to do with me the developer, Google gives you a set time to do it, if it's not done in that time frame then you will not get it. So please don't blame me the developer.

content: Back to the 80s with this classic. Excellent version for mobile. Keeps true to the feel of the original, except I dont have to fill up a machine with 10p pieces! Would be nice to add the voice overs like 'Elf needs food badly'. And the voices of characters as they battle.
replyContent: Always glad to here from a user, yeah its about a 80/20 conversion, I'm trying to find all the voices before I can up them in, I'm in the process of updating the ui, and adding in  gamepad controls and more levels.

content: Controls are OK just a little tricky to get used to but overall a great conversion took me back to 1985 standing in arcades with my 10p :)
replyContent: Thank you very much, I appreciate any feedback from users, updated Ui and more levels very soon.

content: You did a great job bringing this game back thank you im sure you worked hard to do so and i like the fact that its on my mobile device
replyContent: It's nice to hear back from somebody that enjoys what I try to do, I'll bring some new maps very soon, I'm in the process of creating another game, in the speccy.

content: Takes me back to my childhood. If you're not a child of the eighties you cannot appreciate this game. You did a fantastic job!
replyContent: Well thank you again Shawn, it's not perfect, for a game that's 35 years old, recreating it in some way, was a nightmare, but well worth it, Like I said to another user I'll bring some new maps soon to the party, but you can always create some yourself and send them in.

content: Such a shame, so many memories of this game. The controls like everyone has said are sticky. Unfortunately you cant beat the original and joystick.
replyContent: Thank for your comments, this year I created a brand new control system which is better than the original i had, but your correct, you cannot get a proper joystick, 8 way direction is always the hardest on any device, the larger the device you use it on the better the tracking is as the system can track the directions better üòÅ

content: It's does a decent job at replicating the look of the game but the onscreen direction pad is no substitute for a joystick. You should change it to click to move so the player can just click on where they want to go.
Eh
replyContent: Whats is the problem, please let me know so I can help

content: Good port, retains the original sound and feel with controls as good as possible for a touch screen. Update: Thanks for adding a pause function!
replyContent: Thank you for your kind words, the pause is in the pre-Christmas 2019 The new controls joystick system has been released in the February 2020 release.

content: Game controls are not very good not very responsive

content: Uninstalled after 10 minutes. Controls just don't work well/buggy. Tried changing what little options that are available, no help. replyContent:
The game is like the original, in the arcades all them years ago, Some users like the controls some don't, I could not help, like I've done with others, any game like this is not easy to develop on a touch device, you just don't have the feedback.

I've written the joystick controls completely and a new version should be out today

content: Would be better with the original NES controller instead of the oversized transparent joystick and I miss the voices "the valkyrie shot the food". I selected the female valkyrie and got the male valkyrie. But ahhhhhh the memories. A few bug fixes and we're in business :-)

content: I was super excited to see this game available as it brought back nostalgiac memories. Id give 5 stars if you get the upgrade potions in and make this multiplayer (online), and Id pay extra for it no doubt.

i really love this game, i used to play it years ago when i was a kid. i love the fact that you can play it without wifi too..not many games you can. i just dont like the joystick part to much as the character gets stuck a lot and i keep getting slaughtered lol..plus the game seems to freeze alot when the bombs start shooting at me, they just get stuck,and start shaking on the screen but 5 stars for sure
Awful controls
replyContent: Other users have no issues with the controls, or very little, admittedly, it is harder to control on a phone because of the gaps between the 8 possible movement positions, I have 6 different devices here from phones/tablets, on a phone periodically lift your finger, I've phone on smaller devices this help, I am looking into a new system.

content: I remember this game from my childhood, but if I'm paying for a game I don't expect adverts.
replyContent: you are missing the point here, if you went to the arcade and put money in at the end would you get to play again for free without spending money? if I took that out I would have to charge 3/4 times as much, I've made NOTHING off adverts so far, now for watch an ad you get 10x as much health as you did at the start requested by users.

content: Best retro game ever! Alot of fun to play. I played this game already 30 years ago and now I can enjoy it again- sweet. Thanks for the update.

content: Trouble already w/ level 3. It takes 2 keys to unlock the iron gates and there's only 1 key on the map ???
replyContent: Just like the original, if you stay still for 30 seconds all doors on that level will open, keys are there to aid you and for you to decide on what door to open, but you don't actually need them, although later levels it get hard if you run out.

content: I've been  after this game for ages I love the classic 80s game

You got it working, so can you let me know what you did, just in case I need to patch that part.

Yeah I think it's the Internal API (sometimes it reports backwards), that is causing the problem, if you release your finger for a split second it will sort itself out, I'm however doing a new version this week I would of released it last week but I wanted to test it more.

content: Wow. Played many hours on this as a kid. Loved it then and i'm loving this now. The controls can be a tad frustrating, but hopfully this can be sorted with time. Player seems to get stuck on the spot sometimes and it took me a while to figure out the health metre. All in all, pretty good.
replyContent: Thank you nick for your lovely reply. every few weeks(sometimes weekly) I add more levels, update the game, currently doing that now, as the game is 35+ years old it's been difficult to find everything, so I update it when I find it, eventually you will play Arcade/ZX Spectrum/NES maps, this is a one man band, so it takes time.

content: I like the look, it is pleasantly pixelated and moves fluidly. I also like the layout of the screen with the inventory and powerups across the top. Unfortunately the melee animation for Questor is missing currently and the onscreen joystick controls are extremely imprecise meaning often pressing Left results in me going up to the right. I am using a Sony Xperia Aqua though and it's not the best gaming mobile so I'm not sure where the fault lies. All in all I am pleased with the game as it stands.
replyContent: Thanks for the reply unfortunately I cannot find all the animations, it took me a year to find the original arcade maps(you are playing the ZX spectrum maps) and that was by pure chance, The engine I use can bug out on the API, I have found release your finger and it will sort itself out or try the touchpad. I wish I could find an artist.
